meanings.definition: Submitting a bid lower than a competitor's offer.
meanings.sent1: She was underbidding to win the contract.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to underbid their rivals to secure the project.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer kept underbidding just to see the other bidders' reactions.
meanings.sent4: Underbidding in this case is like playing a strategic game of chess.
meanings.sent5: Underbidding can sometimes lead to winning big contracts.

meanings.definition: Offering a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The underbidding store always had the cheapest products.
meanings.sent2: Customers flocked to the underbidding shop for the best deals.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the underbidding vendor constantly lowering prices.
meanings.sent4: The underbidding strategy was like a secret weapon in the market.
meanings.sent5: The underbidding approach made the business stand out from competitors.

meanings.definition: To bid less than the actual value of something.
meanings.sent1: Buyers were underbidding on the rare painting at the auction.
meanings.sent2: The investor was underbidding on the property to get a good deal.
meanings.sent3: It seemed funny how he kept underbidding on the antique vase.
meanings.sent4: Underbidding on such valuable items felt like a risky adventure.
meanings.sent5: The art collector regretted underbidding on the masterpiece.
